question: Lieutenant Shane Wolfe, United States Navy. I'm gonna get you outta here. But you have to do exactly what I say, when I say it. My way -- no highway option. Do you copy? Where's the briefcase? I've got the Prof and the case. First round's on me back at Virginia Beach. Hold on. You know how to swim? Better keep that on `til we get to the rendezvous point. No. I'm just not big on chit chat.
answer: Lieutenant, thank you. You saved more than just my life today. Can I call my wife to let her know I'm okay?

question: Negative. Not imperative to the mission. We have to keep moving. I have strict orders to get you out of here safely.
answer: I'm safe, Lieutenant. Please. She thinks I'm dead. Don't you have a family?

question: Make it quick.
answer: Joe, Todd, Lulu, Peter, Tyler. My kids. It's voice activated. Designed it myself. I do security, that's my specialty. Those guys back there tried to get this case open for five days -- couldn't crack it. And you should see what happens to you if open it without the code. I have a picture of my kids in here, you want to see it?

question: Negative.
answer: Battery's dead... Honey, I'm alive...

question: We're almost ready. Just gives us a - Professor, RUN!!! Captain, sir.
answer: As you were Lieutenant. We've been through a lot together Shane. You're the best man I ever trained. And a good friend.

question: ... I know sir. And I except full responsibility for the mission's failure.
answer: Why the hell did you let him use the satellite phone?

question: He had to call his family. A lapse in judgement on my part that I regret sir.
answer: ... Plummer was the best security expert the department of defense ever had -- a genius. He was working on a program that scrambles launch codes. He called it G.H.O.S.T.

question: The case was empty sir, as I stated in my report.
answer: Not a surprise, really. Not like the professor to hide things where someone might look for them. G.H.O.S.T. is still out there, which is why I'm going to give you another shot.

question: Sir. Thank you. I... appreciate your confidence. I'll need to put a team together. I'm gonna need the mini sub, I need access to an EP3 aries 2 spy plane...
answer: Negative. It's not that kind of mission. Two days ago, I got a call from the professor's wife... Widow. She told me someone had broken into her home. Searched the place, top to bottom. She's scared. The family's scared. Whoever killed the professor must think G.H.O.S.T. is in that house. Maybe it is, maybe it isn't. Either way, I need someone to stay at that house, and protect them. And while you're there -- find out if the program is in there.

question: That's it? Why would you want me for that, sir.
answer: The professor's wife requested you.

question: Lieutenant Shane Wolfe, reporting for duty.
answer: Of course. I'm so sorry. Thank you for coming. Come in and meet the rest of the gang. KIIIDDS!!! Get your butts down here and say "hello!" You've already met Lulu. This is Peter, Zoe and Todd. Kids, this is Lieutenant Wolfe. He's the man who is going to be staying with us for a while. And this is Helga and Tyler.

question: Ma'am... Baby.
answer: Kids, go finish your homework. And I'll be checking.

question: You have a pleasant family, ma'am.
answer: Charles wasn't around too much. His work took him all over the world. He'd be gone six or seven months at a time. So I think for the younger ones it's a little confusing. Zoe and Todd... well, they're dealing like your normal teenagers. Maybe in Todd's case semi-normal.

question: Mrs. Plummer, I have to tell you that I did everything I could...
answer: Charles was in a dangerous business. I knew it when I married him. No one's to blame here. Everyone thinks that Charles told me or the kids where he hid it. And until G.H.O.S.T. is found, we're all in danger.

question: Nothing will happen to your family as long as I'm here. I've dealt with much...
answer: That's Gary. He was Charles'.

question: Mrs. Plummer-
answer: Call me Julie.

question: ... Mrs. Plummer, I'll go secure the perimeter.
answer: I'm glad you're here- What is it? That's wonderful. This could all be over! I'll be there. Don't worry about the Kids, Helga will handle everything. But if there is an emergency, all the emergency numbers are on the fridge. And on the phone. And on the back door...

question: Don't worry. They'll be safe with me.
answer: Everything will be fine, Mrs. Plummer. Tell me, are you licensed to kill?

question: ... No.
answer: Too bad.

question: Could you turn that dow- Hey- ... Where's the baby? You run a very loose ship.
answer: You don't like it? You're the SEAL. You do something. I make bottle.

question: Usca mi-as chilotii pe crucea lu mata! Listen up, ladies. Your behavior is unacceptable. In order to maintain a state of safety we need to maintain a state of discipline and order. I've only got one rule
answer: Do you copy?

question: What? I said -- do you...
answer: What? I said -- do you...

question: The things I do for my country.
answer: Hi. Zoe thinks you look like the Hulk. I think you're cute.

question: Thank you.
answer: Do you know Kung Fu?

question: Affirmative.
answer: Did you ever punch someone so hard that their head came off? What's that medal for?

question: None of your business.
answer: I'll trade you a SpongeBob button for it. Is that so people can't hurt us?

question: I think -- it's time for you take a nappy- poo, in beddibye land, little girl.
answer: Do I look like I'm five to you?

question: Can you kill a man with your bare hands?
answer: You play too many video games. Yes.

question: ... I can cross my eyes. Wanna see?
answer: Negative.

question: Tyler hates it when I do that...
answer: Plummer residence... yes, I know it's Monday. Oh. Thank you, sir.

question: aby-sitter huh. Well, whatever work you can get. I'm Murphy. Duane. V.P in charge of discipline, conduct and truancy. Top to bottom, K thru 12. You're in my house now, boy. I coach wrestling, too. And the creeper here played hookey from every wrestling practice this month. She's missed twenty-two Driver's Ed classes. Out of twenty-three. They're the worst students in my school.
answer: Good morning kids. What are you doing in my office, Murney?

question: I was explaining, that as vice principal, I am in charge of....
answer: Very little. I thought I asked you to find out who stuck to the baloney slices to the cafeteria ceiling with mustard?

question: I'm got some leads. My informant's about to crack.
answer: Then hop to it. I think I can handle this from here.

question: Then hop to it. I think I can handle this from here.
answer: Red 1, Red 2. Get moving.

question: So. You're the new baby-sitter?
answer: Bodyguard. You see, Mrs. Plummer called my captain, she thought the kids needed -

question: It's okay, Lieutenant, I was briefed of the situation by Mrs. Plummer. She told me all about you. Lieutenant, huh? You with "The Teams?" Petty Officer Third Class Claire Nelson at your service.
answer: ... You're kidding?

question: Four years at Naval base Coronado. The Service paid for my college.
answer: "Honor, Courage...

question: Commitment". That's the way I live my life, and the way I run my school.
answer: Can't be too careful. So. Permission to stick around and keep eyes on the kids?

question: Permission granted. Welcome aboard. Just try not to frighten the children.
answer: No one will even notice I'm here. Clean as a whistle. Back off. Official Business. Give up now. Save us both a world of pain. Now -- last time Open in T minus three, two, one...

question: What would you say is the secret with kids, Mr. Wolfe?
answer: Show no weakness.

question: ... Sure.
answer: So. When you agreed to serve your country, I bet you didn't know you'd be serving creamed bananas to one year olds, huh?

question: Hey -- I out rank you, you know.
answer: Not here, you don't. You're on dry land, lieutenant. Well, not so dry where you're sitting, I guess.

question: Oh, man...
answer: Don't take this personally -- but you're pretty good at this. Seriously, I'm impressed. A whole day, and all three Plummer's stayed out of trouble. That's... unusual.

question: He did.
answer: Todd started a fight with five students at once?

question: The kid's mixed up. Look at him.
answer: If I catch anyone on the team fighting again, next week's tournament is off. I don't care who starts it.

question: You heard the lady. Any more fighting and there'll be no more wrestling. Personally I think that's a little harsh. Boys'll be boys. `Scept for Plummer here.
answer: ... Nice moves, man.

question: Pretty slick, Frogman -- I'm a black belt myself. S'why they asked me to coach the wrestling team. See -- total control. Maybe you could stop by practice, we'd show the boys how a couple of pros do it, what do you say? Come on, promise I'll go easy on you.
answer: ... Sorry, sir. I'm on duty.

question: ... Don't even think it, Murney. He'd kill you so fast, I wouldn't even have time to get my camera. Another day, another dollar twenty, minus taxes... aren't you gonna change him?
answer: I'd love to, for one who'll eat, and not cry.

question: That's not what I mean, Lt.
answer: Oh -- change him. Roger that. Uh...

question: Sirnosir. Not my job.
answer: But...

question: Instructions are right on the box. Bathroom's down the hall. Have fun.
answer: Emergency!

question: Who are those people?
answer: It's my troop, it's Monday. Monday, Wednesday and Saturday are troop nights.

question: Get rid of them.
answer: I can't. Everybody's parents go out on troop nights. They won't be home `til ten. Mom's our den mother. Tonight we're supposed to sell cookies.

question: Selling cookies isn't imperative to my mission.
answer: We have to. If we don't sell enough cookies, we can't go the Jamboree, and if we can't go to the Jamboree. Come on, Shane. You gotta help me out. They already think I'm a loser. And it's not like I have any other friends, cause mom never lets me out of her sight...

question: Where?
answer: Welcome to Chuck E. Cheese!

question: I wish I were in Chechnya.
answer: Anything elsh I can do for you?

question: In a big glass This much ice... this much cyanide.
answer: How `bout a re-fill on that pischer of Mischer Pibb?

question: What?
answer: Pischer of Mischer Pibb? Mischer Pibb?

question: Let's fight!
answer: I'm watching your brother...

question: I pressed two player. I thought you liked combat. Unless you're scared.
answer: That's not fair. Nobody can jump thirty feet.

question: The Hulk can.
answer: That wasn't a documentary. This isn't fair. My joystick's broken.

question: You wanna switch?
answer: You don't have a baby on your chest...

question: Mom -- stop worrying.
answer: I'm a mom, it's my job to worry.

question: Seriously, everything's cool. The guy's just a control freak.
answer: It's only a few more days. I hate leaving you, but you know I have to do this. I love you.

question: Clear out! GO GO GO! Party's over. No one leaves until this house is spotless! I want to be able to eat off the floor! The latrine! Hell, I wanna be able to eat in the kitchen!! Oh no you don't. Now, we're gonna do this my way -- no highway option. Start swabbing, ladies.
answer: It was YOUR idea! I don't even know most of these losers. ... Thanks a lot, Rambo. My friends will never come here again.

question: Those people aren't your friends. They show no respect for you or your house. Because you have no respect for yourself.
answer: I do too respect myself.

question: You got barf on your tank top. Company, downstairs!
answer: You're not my dad! We hate you, you hate us. You're like a robot. Why don't you just leave us alone?

question: They're looking for a program, that your father invented.
answer: So Mom's not paranoid? There really are people out to get us.

question: They're not after you. They want this. But nothing's gonna happen to you, as long as I'm here. And I'm not going anywhere. But I can't do this without your help, okay? We need a little more cooperation here. Tell you what -- let's start over. From now on, you listen to me, and do what I say. And I... I'll listen to you too. Deal? Truce -- okay? C'mon c'mon c'mon...
answer: Hey mom we're fine, absolutely nothing happened you should worry about. Nope.

question: Mrs. Plummer... two men tried to get into the house tonight.
answer: Oh my god!

question: No - it's okay. They're gone, everyone's fine. They were looking for GHOST, but they didn't find it. You have any luck?
answer: Well, yes and no. We found something in the box... But we're not sure what it is. Bill thinks it's part of the GHOST. It looks like some kind of "key". We just don't know what its for. The good news is I'll be home in two days, as soon as the customs paperwork clears.

question: hope you won't go light on him -- that whole family's no good, if you ask me.
answer: I'll talk to him.

question: You're a good man, Shane. Bet you're a hell of a fighter on the mats, huh? Maybe sometime we oughta strap up, we'll give these boys a treat.
answer: Another time, maybe...

question: It's a date then. I'll show you a couple moves. I promise I won't hurt you. See that? You never know when your adversary is going to strike!
answer: Did you kick me in the back? Is there a footprint on my jacket?

question: Come on Frogman! Don't be a sissy!
answer: Wait Todd, I want to talk to you... Smart kid. Zoe, you're in charge. If anyone gets within forty clicks of the perimeter, signal me. Keep all doors sealed, do your homework, preheat the oven, and make sure Lulu brushes her teeth! You want in or out?

question: Wait Todd, I want to talk to you... Smart kid. Zoe, you're in charge. If anyone gets within forty clicks of the perimeter, signal me. Keep all doors sealed, do your homework, preheat the oven, and make sure Lulu brushes her teeth! You want in or out?
answer: You wait little girl, on an empty stage/for fate to turn the light on/your life little girl, is an empty page/that men will want to write on... You are sixteen, going on seventeen... I'm sorry... I'll get it right.

question: No. My hands are freezing.
answer: I'm not going to quit. I hate wresting...

question: AT EASE. Would you listen, just once? Look, I don't know a hell of a lot about this kinda stuff, but... You're good. A lot to learn, but with hard work, discipline -- you could make a go of this.
answer: ... but what about Murney?

question: That guy's an idiot. "Sound of Music" is a great show. My dad took me to see it when I was a kid.
answer: You don't seem like the musical type.

question: Come on. Julie Andrews was hot.
answer: What if... girls'll think I'm... weird or something?

question: You know what girls think is weird? Wrestling. Men in leotards pinning each other to the floor? I've never understood that. Chicks dig guys who can dance.
answer: Doesn't matter now anyway... show's off... it's over.

question: COMPANY -- CENTER STAGE! DO YOU, OR DO YOU NOT HAVE WHAT IT TAKES TO PERFORM THIS MUSICAL? No director? I have directed rescue missions in Afghanistan! I've directed numerous snatch and grabs in countries who's names you are not allowed to know. I have choreographed multi-pronged amphibious landings and stealth air attacks! Do you think I have the stomach to whip this production into shape, or not?
answer: Yes.

question: YES WHAT? ... What's up?
answer: Nothing... It's stupid... Scott. I called him in his room, another girl picked up the phone. I know it's no big deal. I don't know why I let it get to me.

question: I don't see what you see in this guy.
answer: It's just nice to think someone's thinking about you, you know?

question: It won't happen again.
answer: ... No wait! ...What are you gonna do? You're not gonna hurt him are you? Promise you won't touch him.

question: Okay. I promise. I won't touch him.
answer: Tell me a story.

question: Okay. Let's see. Once there was a family of Elves. One day, the little Elf family -- Uh. Went into the magic forest. To find a secret gnome... facility, where gnomes where turning mushrooms into... Uranium. The elves had to go in and take it out.
answer: Why?

question: They were ordered to. By the Elf Unit commander at Elf station bravo. So -- they waited for cloud cover, and they came in from the north... The Elf Team decided on an L Ambush -- so three elves formed a base leg and laid down a heavy suppressive fire on the gnomes while the others maneuvered around to the right flank and walked through finishing off anything left alive... I mean standing... D ISSOLVE TO: ... And not one Elf got left behind that day. We got `em all. Even, the teeniest little elf of all -- Rodriquez. Oh, c'mon... I can't remember that thing.
answer: I'll write it down for you...

question: When you're down and low, lower than the floor. And you ain't got a chance. Don't make a move `til you're in the groove, and do the Panda Dance...
answer: You have to do the dance. Like dad used to do. He made it up for him.

question: Do you know what causes most accidents? ttention span. The most important thing is that you keep an absolute focus on... THE ROAD! Don't look at me...
answer: What?!? You wanna drive?

question: No. Keep going. I trust you. Good. Next lesson, 1500 hours.
answer: Ha ha ha. Very funny.

question: I've had it. I just caught this boy dancing under the bleachers like some kind of Bavarian fruitcake. I want this freak outta my school and into treatment. Somebody needs to give this punk a talking to...
answer: Hey. I'm right here. Talk.

question: You got something to say? Boy?
answer: Yeah. Yeah I do. I quit, Murney.

question: Winners never quit, boy. What're you so scared of, Freak?
answer: I am not scared. I... I want to sing. I'm in Sound of Music. It opens Friday...

question: A musical? You're blowing off wrestling for a musical? This is what happens when there's no man in the house.
answer: There is a man in my house -- me. Let's get one thing clear. I'm not quitting cause I hate wresting. I'm quitting because you're a bad coach. You suck. The whole team wants to quit. I'm the only one with the guts to do it.

question: I'll be sure to lock up when I'm through.
answer: Pinned! Is he okay?

question: Dislocated nerve, that's all. He'll be fine in two months.
answer: That was awesome.

question: I'm not your daddy, Peter. But sweet dreams.
answer: Go away and we won't hurt you. Uh oh. You're gonna have to pay for that.

question: That's my troop.
answer: From now on, you do things our way -- no highway option!

question: It's all in the wrist...
answer: Don't worry. I'm not gonna jump.

question: What's wrong... Scott?
answer: o. Scott's fine. I don't know what you did, but he's really straightened up. Flowers, phone calls. ...I've never been in love like this before.

question: How long you been together?
answer: A month...

question: That's longer than any relationship I've ever had.
answer: You're okay, Shane. I'm not used to anyone giving me the benefit of the doubt. My teachers don't trust me. Mom doesn't. My dad didn't care about us, he was never here...

question: Hey. Your father cared about you very deeply. He told me you were the greatest things in his life. That what's bothering you? Cause -- we can talk about it, if you want.
answer: I miss him so much...

question: This was my dad's. He was the only family I ever had. Mom left when I was little, cause dad was always gone. Two years in... an indisclosable locale. Another six in... Another indisclosable locale. I didn't really have a home, so I went to military school -- then one day my mom got the letter. No more dad. I always wanted to be just like him. I'm starting to realize, I never really knew him. I don't know if I'm like him or not.
answer: That's horrible, Shane.

question: How does it work?
answer: How does what work?

question: Don't play dumb. It's getting old. I want to know how to get through the booby traps. What's the code?
answer: I don't know any code -- Charles didn't tell me about the room...

question: Come on. Use the gas, not the brake, 5-0.
answer: I'd say you could lose your license -- but you haven't got one!

question: People are trying to kill us. They have my mom, and our bodyguard -- you have to follow me!
answer: Just pull over!

question: Wriggle like a snake `til you can't no more. Then better jump quick, like there ain't no floor. Almost done, almost done... "Just hold your breath, and jump to the left." And that's the Peter Panda Dance.
answer: Thank you, Shane. You were always my best man. I knew you'd figure it out. You know, if you're willing to join up, I'd be happy to cut you in on the proceeds. What do you say -- we make a good team?

question: I was devoted to you, sir. And you betrayed all of that. All that we stand for.
answer: I'll take that as a "no." ... I think you better open it. Wait. That's just what you want isn't it? You open it. Oh come on. I walked the floor first.

question: There will be no mercy.
answer: None requested.
